p: Hyperferritinaemia (mean 1297.6 ng/ml in non-survivors vs 614.0 ng/ml in survivors; P < 0.001) was highly discriminatory as were IL-6 levels ( P < 0.0001), suggesting that mortality might be due to virally driven hyperinflammation and may also be a marker of virally induced haemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis.( 12, 13)
